results.title: Commutativity
results.brief_description: Uses animation, appropriate sound effects and narration to explain the principles of commutativity. Demonstrates that addition is commutative but subtraction is not. Stresses use of commutative property to make learning of addition facts easier.

results.title: Community service
results.brief_description: Film uses two PMG trainee staff as a link to the various activities which take place at the Seventh World Rover Moot at Yarra Brae, Victoria, in January 1962, attended by 1000 rovers from fifteen nations. Countries represented included Sweden, Ceylon, Japan, Papua and Canada. The painted tents of the Canadians depict how they travelled to the moot to join in the many tasks, games, tours and service activities undertaken during the fortnight. The spontaneous songs, the final ceremony and church service shows the fun of rover scout activities and the fine spirit of community service developed.

results.title: Community responsibilities
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Gudrun Parker
results.brief_description: In good citizenship where does a person’s duty to the community end? Where does obligation to oneself or one’s family begin when apportioning one’s spare time and energy? These questions come under vigorous discussion when a member of an urban community is approached by two of his neighbors to head a worthwhile community project. He declines on the grounds that one such commitment leads to another, to the extent of infringing on his personal freedom. One of his neighbors feels he is shirking responsibility in refusing; the other thinks perhaps he is right in resisting community pressure. The audience is invited to discuss the matter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Guy Glover and Gudrun Parker

results.title: Community in quest
results.creator_credit: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman
results.brief_description: Depicts the political realities that can prevent much needed drug programs from operating in a town. In this film the city leaders are frightened when their traditional values are threatened by unknown methods and they react negatively to a drug program which utilises sensitivity and role playing techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Extension Media Center, University of California, Los Angeles, National Institute of Mental Health (U.S.) and Lyn Littman

results.title: Community health: the Australian concept
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Suzanne Baker and John Sexton
results.brief_description: Produced for the Hospitals and Health Services Commission, the film illustrates current developments in the area of community health in Australia, paying particular attention to the new initiatives and trends introduced by the Health agencies.

results.title: Community chest
results.brief_description: A college student reports on the work of the Community Chest movement in the city of Yonkers, USA. The film explains that the Community Chest is a central fund-raising and administrative organization through which various social welfare agencies receive funds according to their needs. Finance for the Community Chest is obtained from a yearly drive among all sections of the community. In this way individual agencies are relieved of the work of fund-raising, thus enabling them to concentrate on their welfare activities.

results.title: Communities keep clean
results.brief_description: Compares community cleaning to house cleaning and includes scenes of street cleaning, water purification, park upkeep, landfill projects and air apollution control. Emphasizes that community upkeep is a shared responsibility.
